Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer, and will undergo Lumpectomy with radiation. Does anyone know ways they deliver radiation? And what side effects have anyone experienced , and are there any way we can eliminate or at least lessen the effects? Any comment will be very much appreciated.
Posts.Title: Radiation and side effects

Posts.Content: On Jan 19, 2011 4:19 PM grettalong wrote: I had my eye taken out in sep for melanoma,test's showed lung and lyph node cancer,I went threw half of the treatment then quit,I couldn't handle the pain it caused me,I told my doc's I was ready to kiss the sky;a mamagramm was ordered now they want to do a biopsy on my breast's,I feel enough is enough,how much can a person take. Please don't loose hope. There are a lot of help out there, especially for Alternative Medicine. One important thing about having cancer is to make your body strong,inorder for it to be ready to fight the cancer cells, as well as the treatment you have to go through. If you can manage to visit a Naturopathic Dr.Â  they can give you a lot of supplements that can help your body cope, and make your quality of life better and bearable. If you want more information, please let me know, I'm here to help. I am a breast cancer patient too.
Posts.Title: Too Much
